children.name: select
children.description: Fires when a menu item gets selected.

children.name: deactivate
children.description: Fires when a sub menu or the ContextMenu gets closed and its animation finished.

children.name: activate
children.description: Fires when a sub menu or the ContextMenu gets opened and its animation finished.

children.name: open
children.description: Fires before a sub menu or the ContextMenu gets opened. You can cancel this event to prevent opening the sub menu.

children.name: close
children.description: Fires before a sub menu or the ContextMenu gets closed. You can cancel this event to prevent closure.

children.name: remove
children.description: Removes a specified item(s) from a **ContextMenu**.

children.name: open

parameters.name: y `Number` *optional*
parameters.description: Y coordinate in pixels. If not specified, ContextMenu will assume the first parameter is an anchor element.

parameters.name: x `Number|Element|jQuery`
parameters.description: X coordinate in pixels or the anchor element to which to align. If passed an item - jQuery object or element - it will be opened.

children.description: Shows the **ContextMenu** at the specified coordinates in pixels or aligned to the specified anchor. If passed an item, it will be opened. This method can be prevented to stop the ContextMenu from opening.

children.name: insertBefore

parameters.name: referenceItem `String|Element|jQuery`
parameters.description: A reference item to insert the new item before

parameters.name: item `Object|Array`
parameters.description: Target item, specified as a JSON object. Can also handle an array of such objects.

children.description: Inserts an item into a **ContextMenu** before the specified referenceItem.

children.name: insertAfter

parameters.name: referenceItem `String|Element|jQuery`
parameters.description: A reference item to insert the new item after.

parameters.name: item `Object|Array`
parameters.description: Target item, specified as a JSON object. Can also handle an array of such objects.

children.description: Inserts an item into a **ContextMenu** after the specified referenceItem.

children.name: enable
children.description: Enables or disables an item of a **ContextMenu**. This can optionally be accomplished oninitialization by setting the **disabled="disabled"** on the desired menu item html element.

children.name: destroy
children.description: Prepares the **ContextMenu** for safe removal from DOM. Detaches all event handlers and removes jQuery.data attributes to avoid memory leaks. Calls destroy method of any child Kendo widgets.> **Important:** This method does not remove the ContextMenu element from DOM.

children.name: close

parameters.name: element `Element|jQuery`
parameters.description: If called without arguments, will close the ContextMenu. If passed an item, it will be closed (if opened).

children.description: Closes the **ContextMenu**. This method can be prevented to stop the closure.

children.name: append

parameters.name: referenceItem `String|jQuery`
parameters.description: A reference item to append the new item in. Root context menu if not specified.

parameters.name: item `Object|Array`
parameters.description: Item to be appended, specified as a JSON object. An array of objects can also be passed.

children.description: Appends an item to a **ContextMenu** in the specified referenceItem's sub menu (or the root context menu if not specified).

children.name: target
Show the ContextMenu on element with ID target

children.description: Specifies the element on which ContextMenu should open. The default element is the document body.

children.name: showOn
Show the ContextMenu on left click

children.description: Specifies the event or events on which ContextMenu should open. By default ContextMenu will show on *contextmenu* event on desktop and *hold* event on touch devices.Could be any pointer/mouse/touch event, also several, separated by spaces.

children.name: popupCollision
children.description: Specifies how ContextMenu should adjust to screen boundaries. By default the strategy is **"fit"** for a sub menu with a horizontal parent or the root menu,meaning it will move to fit in screen boundaries in all directions, and **"fit flip"** for a sub menu with vertical parent, meaning it will fit vertically and flip overits parent horizontally. You can also switch off the screen boundary detection completely if you set the **popupCollision** to false.

children.name: orientation
children.description: Root menu orientation. Could be horizontal or vertical.

children.name: hoverDelay
children.description: Specifies the delay in ms before the sub menus are opened/closed - used to avoid accidental closure on leaving.

children.name: filter
Show the ContextMenu on some elements inside the target

children.description: Specifies ContextMenu filter selector - the ContextMenu will only be shown on items that satisfy the provided selector.

children.name: direction
children.description: Specifies ContextMenu's sub menu opening direction. Can be "top", "bottom", "left", "right".The example below will initialize the sub menus to open to the left.

children.name: dataSource
children.description: The data source of the widget which is used to render its items. Can be a JSON object/Array that contains an item or an Array of items to be rendered.Refer to the example below for a list of the supported properties.

children.name: closeOnClick
children.description: Specifies that sub menus should close after item selection (provided they won't navigate).

children.name: animation.open.duration
children.description:
Defines the open animation duration in milliseconds.
Target
  • Item 1
    • Sub Item 1
    • Sub Item 2

  • Item 2

children.name: animation
children.description: A collection of **Animation** objects, used to change default animations. A value of false will disable all animations in the widget.Available animations for the **ContextMenu** are listed below.  Each animation has a reverse options which is used for the **close** effect by default, but can be over-riddenby setting the **close** animation. Each animation also has a direction which can be set off the animation (i.e. **slideIn:Down**).

children.name: alignToAnchor
children.description: Specifies that ContextMenu should be shown aligned to the target or the filter element if specified.
